data.title: Terence Lester, Ph.D. on LinkedIn: #juneteenth #lovebeyondwalls
data.meta_description:
Last night, I had the honor of being the Golden Spike Hitter for the Atlanta United FC game in honor of #Juneteenth.

I‚Äôm grateful for the work we‚Äôve done to‚Ä¶
data.text:
I got a chance to give a talk to the staff at The Coca-Cola Company, in partnership with Love Beyond Walls, about what it means to imagine dignity in the unhoused community and serve the greater community during apathetic times. I‚Äôm also grateful this company chose to come alongside us to serve our community members through their Data Analytics and Reporting team. P.S. Huge shoutout to The Sketch Effect for capturing a powerful day through illustration. #lovebeyondwalls

I got a chance to give a talk to the staff at The Coca-Cola Company, in partnership with Love Beyond Walls, about what it means to imagine dignity in the unhoused community and serve the greater community during apathetic times. I‚Äôm also grateful this company chose to come alongside us to serve our community members through their Global Finance team. P.S. Huge shoutout to The Sketch Effect for capturing a powerful day through illustration. #lovebeyondwalls

Two years ago today, after a doctor‚Äôs appointment, I was told it would be a year to a year and a half before I could walk again. I was devastated. I wrestled with grief, anxiety, and the trauma from this unexpected tragedy. Almost a year after I was preparing to lose my father üôèüèæ Fast forward, I have since completed my PhD, became a director/professor, wrote two books (one with my daughter) with one forthcoming in 2025 called, From Dropout to Doctorate, received one of the biggest partnerships to date to advocate on behalf of the unhoused through Love Beyond Walls and can walk up to 6 miles at a time now. I don‚Äôt know where you are, but please do not give up. This is not my comeback story anymore, this is my God never left story. P.S. In 8 days, I will celebrate 18 years of marriage with my best friend Cecilia Lester, and something special is loading.

This morning, I shed a few tears after hitting send on the email! I have officially submitted a 71,000-word draft of part of my life story, with the working title, ‚ÄúFrom Dropout to Doctorate.‚Äù I wrote it during one of the heaviest grieving periods of my life. I hope this book inspires those labeled as coming from the wrong side of the tracks to rise above every stat stacked against them. Book five is loading. Never give up! #lovebeyondwalls
